subtitles.transcript: Undoubtedly Berkeley has drifted or shifted somewhat toward
let’s say, the University of Michigan.
The University of Michigan, a public university,
but it’s becoming more and more like a private university.
That is its tuitions have gone up,
but also it is taking more out-of-state people in order to have full tuitions.
It’s taking more foreign students whose parents are quite wealthy
in order to subsidize everything else it does so that it is starting to look like a public-private university.
We’re not there yet. We still have a way to go,
but if the trend continues that has been started
because of state budget cutbacks, we could find ourselves
as a kind of University of Michigan quasi-public institution.
